body: Hi All, I would like to work on this issue if this is still open.
@rajpratyush still open, yes that would be great! Do you need any more info from us?

issue.title: Tutorial / Examples for automatic layouts
issue.body: A jupyter notebook tutorial for automatic layouts would be super useful, along with the graphs rendered.

body:
yes @bdpedigo I would like to know what files needs to be changed as I don't have much experience regarding opensource, but I am willing to learn and move ahead in this journey. I would really appreciate some guidance from you as well.
Many thanks,
Sounds good @rajpratyush - what is your familiarity with open source thus far (e.g. git, github, making a PR, etc)?

With regard to the actual changes that need to be made, all of the functions that @loftusa mentioned are in this file: https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/graspologic/utils/utils.py. @loftusa any other functions that you think should be changed?

You will need to change:
- the name of the function in the function signature
- the name of the function wherever else it appears in the library
- the name of the function in the corresponding documentation
- the name of the function in any tutorials, if applicable (I don't think any of these functions get called in the tutorials but I could be wrong). The tutorials live [here](https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/tree/dev/docs/tutorials)

I would recommend trying to use some sort of IDE with a variable naming tool (VS code, for instance) because many of those tools can change a function name throughout the entire library for you. If not, then something like find and replace, but again, would have to make sure to check other files in the library.

I know all the basic git commands know how to use github creating an issue and making a PR , FORK, pushing to remote repository. The experience i lack i am deficient of is of working on large codebases @bdpedigo
Sure sir i will start my work on it tommorrow itself @bdpedigo  will keep you posted regarding the progress i have made.

issue.title: Cleaner function names
issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look at
the contribution guidelines: https://github.com/microsoft/graspologic/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
Review and close #586 
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.
Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->

#### What does this implement/fix? Briefly explain your changes.
changed the function names to give them a cleaner look
utils.to_laplace -> to_laplacian
utils.get_lcc -> largest_connected_component
utils.get_multigraph_union_lcc and utils.get_multigraph_intersect_lcc -> multigraph_lcc_union and multigraph_lcc_intersection respectively
utils.cartprod -> cartesian_product
#### Any other comments?
I have changed:

the name of the function in the function signature
the name of the function wherever else it appears in the library
the name of the function in the corresponding documentation
the name of the function in any tutorials
